website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best playset on the market when it comes to sparking kids' imaginations for building and creating. STEM based – a popular theme in today's toys that encourages learning.
pros: We love this set for offering versatile play that's challenging, educational, and fun
Can be used with additional Playmags set
cons: On the higher end of the price range
Some sets don't come with the advertised idea book
Contains small pieces – not for kids under 3

website_summaries.verdict: Educational, addictive, hands-on fun for the whole family. If you're looking for an engaging STEM toy without electricity or a screen, this is one to consider.
pros: A comprehensive set of 3D blocks that is easy for anyone to use
Colorful with solidly built magnetic tiles
cons: Slightly more expensive than some other STEM toys

customer_reviews.title: My kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. They are strong and good quality. I wouldn't buy another brand. I saw my local library carrying this brand and I figure that if it can handle library kids abuse, it can handle my kids.
customer_reviews.author: The Hornbys

customer_reviews.title: More than a toy, a tool for creativity
customer_reviews.text: I can just say wow. This is a tool for creativity, fun guaranteed. Got them for my daughter this Christmas, and she loved it. I won’t describe how good they are compared to other brands, I can just say you can have fun without worrying about the magnet force being weak. My daughter loves them, she realized she can construct buildings, houses, etc for her Polly Pocket dolls. And I love to see how her creativity bursts with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with this!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. We already feel we should have ordered more. Finally game that parents can play with the kids and themselves feel entertained too. I was starting to give up on kids games as most of them are just too boring for adults. Strong magnets. As you can see in my pictures, the house we built had few magnets taken out by my son, the building still stands with back magnetic tiles. They r strong !
customer_reviews.author: B. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Could be better...
customer_reviews.text: I wish the magnets were stronger, when your building vertically it's a little hard for then to stay up. Also the blocks came in a little scuffed. But my son is having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Casey

customer_reviews.title: breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I have several sets of magna tiles, magnetic stick and stack and play mags this set breaks easily Horrible product left a review before about them but they broke within the first week magnets fell out of the tiles we had to throw away over half of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wright

customer_reviews.title: Picture is Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: The picture is very deceiving. Part of the set includes 18 click-ins peices which have no use in the actual building an the car pictured is not included. Would rather buy a 100 piece set where all 100 pieces are useful to build. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: drftgyh

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and expensive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these. I sure as heck paid enough money for them. But these are of lousy quality and a serious choking hazard - the pieces can come apart quite easily and the tiny magnets and even teensy tinier little washers that hold the flimsy plastic pieces together are set loose. I have found this to happen several times. Not safe for 3 year-olds. I think these should for children ages 5+. Or perhaps just need to be made better - my mom bought a different brand (not sure name) as a Xmas gift for my son and while they aren't transparent, they are much much sturdier. I let him play with those.
customer_reviews.author: mrsslabbers

customer_reviews.title: Edges break exposing magnets
customer_reviews.text: Had these for 5 weeks and loved them and then this (refer to photo). The plastic is breaking and a magnet is exposed and is about to fall out. Awesome hazard for our toddler running around while his older sister builds stuff. SUPER disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lobdell

customer_reviews.title: Rivets are deceptive - magnets fall out!
customer_reviews.text: Value set "updated" to less tiles. The first box I purchased had 100 magnetic tiles, not counting the click-ins. Great! I bought a second set a couple weeks later and the box was smaller and now only has 82. It is very deceiving in the description. I am not happy. Update: 10/17/19: Several of these have been thrown in the trash. The rivets are misleading, they do not actually hold them together!! One of the sides is simply snapped and glued. Once it separates, the magnets fall out. The rivets are only on one side, the second side has cutouts for the rivet holes. It's very deceptive - they are not any safer.
customer_reviews.author: Big crazy family

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product
customer_reviews.text: Comparing similar product (Picasso tiles) with the Playmag tiles. I have purchased both sets for Christmas gifts for grandkids. After having the opportunity to enjoy creative play time with the two different sets of mag tiles, hands down the Playmag tiles are much more durable than the Picasso mag tiles. Both sets are are equally enjoyable to get creative with, however Playmag tiles feel heavier and seem the most user friendly! Both sets have provided a wonderful alternative to spending mindless screen time for many family members and especially grandkids! Fun for all ages. Entertaining and educational. Solid investment! Sincerely, Grandma Paula
customer_reviews.author: paula j kramer

customer_reviews.title: STRONGER THAN MAGNA-TILES....YES YOU READ THAT RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: We have crazy art tiles, and the well known super expensive MAGNA-TILES........and these play mags (with the strongest magnets) are by far stronger than both! Including the magna-tiles and in my opinion the quality of the plastic is way better than the crazy art tiles, and you almost cant tell the difference in the playmag plastic and the magna tiles......I would recomend these Over magna-tiles because they are stronger magnets and the plastic is almost identical......awesome quality and perfect price point! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: johanna r hummel

customer_reviews.title: Careful for punching
customer_reviews.text: Daughter LOVES LOVES LOVES these!!thoufh really glad we got 2 boxes because I can’t imagine us being able to make too many items with only one box. The little book that has ideas to make at beginner, intermediate, and advanced levels are a little misleading as they have things built using items not included in the box like a little car or any form of domed ceiling. Also, every now and then we’ll get some magnets that you can’t get them to attract but actually move opposite ways no matter how you arrange it. Not too often, but occasionally happens. Highly recommend!! Can pinch fingers, so careful with little fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Unfinished Sharp edges, great durability and strong magnets
customer_reviews.text: About 75% of the pieces have very sharp unfinished 90° edges that could cut tiny hands. It seems like the manufacturer either had poorly sealing dies or did not smooth the edges from the factory. I had to take a file to most of the pieces to knock down the sharp edges for my toddler. Otherwise the pieces are very robust, magnets very strong, though sometimes they are magnetized such that they don't line up. Compatible with my two other sets from other manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Worried at first if they really work.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my daughter's children, ages 1, 3, 6 and 8. They already had a set of 100 piece Magna Tile and they love playing with this stuff so much, we thought to supplement the set they already play with. We were a little unsure about mating PlayMags with Magna Tiles, but the value was so much better here that we took a chance. No reason to worry, now they have over two hundred pieces that fit together well and with three kids playing with it sometimes at the same time, no shortage of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for a range of young children
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren LOVE these - play with them for hours. Don't offhand know what age they are recommended for - you'll have to check - but ranging from 7 years to a 1 year old, ALL of my grandchildren are engaged in playing with these, under supervision, and we haven't seen any danger to be concerned with. They are much more practical - manipulatable. Unlike Legos, they don't require great find motor, and the possible creations are quicker to form, so that they don't become bored or frustrated due to their developmental level. I gave several different batches of these to my grandchildren instead of a bunch of small insignificant individualized gifts, and it was a BIG hit.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: First set was great! Second set, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second 100 piece set I ordered from Amazon. The first one was fine and came with a variety of colors. This set contained mostly fluorescent orange and green square tiles and the large square tiles were all red. Not the end of the world, but certainly not representative of the product photo for this listing. I also had a tile where the magnet was not in the slot when the tile was sealed and riveted together. I tried contacting them via the email address listed on the enclosed product sheet but have not heard anything back. The second set was a letdown after a good experience with the first set.
customer_reviews.author: EYW

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased another set of playmags previously from a different source (not Amazon). The tiles I received with this order were noticeably lower quality than the set I already owned. Both the feel and the color of the plastic look cheaper, and there were already some cracks in a few of the plastic pieces. Some of the magnet alignment was also not great, so that not all of the pieces fit together as well as they should. I would normally return this but given how things are at the moment (i.e. shelter-in-place), we will live with it. I would not recommend purchasing this particular set, although I 100% recommend magnetic tiles as a toy for kids.
customer_reviews.author: wakytac

customer_reviews.title: Great building set, but we received only one purple square.
customer_reviews.text: I spent probably six or eight hours obsessively reading reviews of the various magnetic building sets like this that compared the quality of the products sold by different companies. I also watched some YouTube product comparison videos—and was convinced that Playmags was probably the best. Indeed, they are FUN, FUN, FUN! My only complaint with this 118 piece set is that we received one (1) measly purple square. Hello? This must be a packaging mistake, right? The Amazon product photo certainly shows more that one purple square. We are kind of sad about having only one purple square.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: We have had these for 2.5 years and they have been fantastic. One of the most consistently played with toys. My daughter is 4 now and still plays with them a lot. I did a lot of research of these vs the brand name and after using them for so long, I realized what was really important was having lots of peices, we bought another set (so 200 peices) and I feel that is the minimum needed to really be creative with them. I love that they dont hurt to step on like legos. The one downside is that the creations are fragile. You can build a plane and then go flying it around.
customer_reviews.author: flutefairy

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised as magnetic tiles 100 pcs, but... in fact there are only 82 magnetic tiles and the rest just inserts with no magnets, so they don't give you extra material for building. Moreover ther is "bonus" projct ideas book. But you can't make those projects because therevate no tiles you need in this particular set. Which gonna make your child kind of upset. So, the "bonus" it's just comercial. Overvise this is afun toy, but a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tile- one small downfall! Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: So my daughters love these playmag tiles. Definitely comparable to the original magna tiles . The only downfall is the first set came , and quite a few tiles were scratched up, they sent me a replacement order (which was very generous ) and a lot of those were badly scratched before playing with. The customer service was great, and I do realize that after playing with them they will get scratches etc, my only concern would be people giving them as a gift. I wouldn’t want to be on the receiving end thinking it was a used toy. Other than that aspect, I would definitely purchase them for my girls again if we needed More !
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Dion

customer_reviews.title: Building Imaginations
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this so much. I have in fact bought a few over the last few months! This item is sturdy and super easy to use! I loved how it came with ideas and guides for building items but allows the kids to build whatever their minds can think up. Only issue is the scratching but that is nothing to really be concerned about.
customer_reviews.author: Start Up Guy

customer_reviews.title: All blocks are scratched
customer_reviews.text: The product in itself is very good. The magnets are strong and hold together well to form buildings or rather blocks. Not all the pieces are magnets though. There are some windows, alphabets, patio squares which fit very well and add to the playability. It is a pity that the seller I bought it from has sent me scratched blocks. Not one, not two but all of them. And it is not a scratch or two. They are massively scratched. Unless that is a feature of the product, these are 2nd hand item not in new condition. I'm not going to return in this pandemic but beware of vendor with toy in its name.
customer_reviews.author: tushar

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them
customer_reviews.text: My kids played with their Magna Tiles more than any other toy, but would often run out of pieces when building things. These were a great cost-effective compatible set (great starter set on their own as well), and my kids love them. They aren't throwing them around the room (at least when we're watching), but they aren't being overly careful with these, and we've yet to break a single piece. This was a home-run holiday gift.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Get your kids off video games
customer_reviews.text: Great entertainment for children and adults alike. Gets the creative juices flowing. Magnets are strong. I have bought 3 sets for my grandson and he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this magnet block set 3 months ago due to so many 5 star reviews. I like it at the first because It does have very bright colors and it has good quality and strong magnet. However be careful if your kids are toddlers because these blocks have too strong magnet that it could draw 2 blocks together at one blow. My 2 yr old daughter already got pinched twice and it really hurts for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Anna W

customer_reviews.title: Great tiles, stong, durable, endless fun!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this set! Will be ordering more asap! My kid's grandparents have both Picasso + Magnatiles but not this brand. It stands up next to the other 2 brands just as well but the bonus is the click-ins + the little window pieces included. Truth be told, I was just as excited receiving them as the kids were + these seem super stong + durable. More than happy with this purchase + again, ordering more immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you need these in your life.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 boys play with this all the time. Its NOT one of those toys they play with and get bored of. I can pull it out every day and theyll sit and build with it for an hour. And thats saying something for my 2,4,&6 year old boys. Oh and theyre favorite thing is having me come video it slow motion when they kick/smach/drop their creation. Then we have to sit and watch the videos after amd send it to all the cousins to see of they can one up us. (They all have the sets too) So, yeah, theyre great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: First time buyer here....we love these!! We usually have the wooden blocks and wanted something different and stumbled upon these. Magnets are very durable, bright fun colors, and comes with plenty of different shapes. We happily will be buying additional pieces to create larger structures and to make cars etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy760

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOY EVER
customer_reviews.text: We have had Playmags for three years. We have about five or six of these big sets now because we have two boys that like to build big. They are the one toy that literally gets played with every single day. They are compatible with Magnatiles, and we have one small set of Magnatiles because we wanted some accessories (stairs for houses), and I 100% prefer Playmags. They have noticeably stronger magnets. My kids have also played with Picasso Tiles, and they are much weaker. Playmags are our favorite. It allows for so much creative play. Can’t recommend them enough.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Better than Magna-tiles!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because I wanted to supplement the Magnatile set that we received as a gift. I read these were compatible, and the price was much lower. Not only are they compatible, the magnets are visibly larger making the tiles stick slightly better allowing for my kids to build more stable structures. I'm very happy with this set. Also, a minor thing, but the storage bag it comes with is a nice touch. Toy storage is always an issue. It's kind of a flimsy bag but better than nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Kobayashi

customer_reviews.title: Loads for fun....
customer_reviews.text: These were such a big hit that we ended up buying another set. Initially I really struggled with purchasing another brand. The trade off of having more pieces was the deal breaker. I am very happy with this purchase. They have provided hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Clarine

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Even you'll play with it!
customer_reviews.text: Great set, kids love. Strong magnets. Both my 5 and 8 year old continue to use these, even after other toys are long forgotten. Interchangeable with other brands. We like and recommend the large bottom magnets to build on to allow us to transfer our build if we want. We have 2 sets, about 120 actual magnets, as one is never enough. The "100" piece set is a little misleading, however, as it includes several snap-in letters for the open pieces, making it "100" pieces, so be sure to check actual magnet count if you're looking for a specific number of actual play tiles. Great buy, though.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Still better compared to magnatiles
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought that these magnets were weak but I bought a set of magnatiles and was shocked to see these playmags are a bit stronger and cost about half as much. I guess I'll be returning the magnatiles.
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: strong magnets and very versatile
customer_reviews.text: my son likes building toys in general and this is probably his favorite. he likes to build with it better than Legos even. so we bought him more of these very soon as he was running out of pieces building larger and larger structures for his cars. pretty durable. we had them for about a yr now and only a couple of them have small cracks on the side, not affecting play though. also not a lot of visible scratches either. highly recommended for builder kids.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Magnets fall out!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a fan of these until today when my son showed me one of the broken ones where the magnet fell out. These have always been played with on carpet so they haven’t had any impact to them. I started inspecting all of them and discovered about 1/4 of them to be starting to disintegrate and I know they’ll lose the magnet inside soon. I’m unfortunately throwing them all in the trash because with a 6 month old now in the home I can’t risk a magnet falling out and her accidentally ingesting one. 🙁.
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: Use creativity Book for Ideas
customer_reviews.text: Comes with small (4" X 5 1/2") Creativity Book which shows pictures of ideas/things you can build with the magnetic tiles - divided into Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced. I bought the 100-piece set but not all the ideas are buildable because they show parts not included in this set, such as wheels and small cars and trucks. There are no instructions. It would have been helpful to know the number and letter tiles are not magnetic, but must be clicked onto the center of certain tiles.
customer_reviews.author: D Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great quality magnetic blocks for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: The quantity of tiles is great. There are enough for a couple kids to play together without fighting over pieces. The magnets are strong and stable. The locks come with a great book of structures you can make but contains a good amount of pieces that are not in this set. These blocks are definitely worth the purchase at a fraction of the price of other blocks. I was surprised how long this held the attention of a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Whole family loves them!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 23 month old has been playing with these for 2 months. We love them! Every once in a great while he’ll catch a finger in between but overall they’re just the right strength. Way better than magnatiles since the magnetism always lines up in them, except the small rectangles. Those have to be flipped to line up. The gate pieces are weaker magnets but still good for creativity. He loves the train pieces too, those don’t leave the table. The 12x12 and 6x6s are also key to being able to build. So glad we got these!
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toys for all
customer_reviews.text: These tiles promote lots of creativity and all of my grandchildren love them, ages 2 - 6. Even the 2 year olds can build things with them. The adults get in on the fun as well. We have 3 sets and I might order another one. The only drawback is that there are 100 pieces, but some of the pieces are letter pieces and not magnetic. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always need more
customer_reviews.text: I already purchased 3 sets of 100pcs each and plan on buying more. I love the brand and the price. My Daycare kids can play for hours. these are used in my classroom everyday and I just need to buy 3 more sets to let the kids building and coming up with new designs without running short of magnets. next I want to add the cars and magnets people to amplify play time.
customer_reviews.author: Mirella

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Strong magnets.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Almost perfect match in size to a set we already owned. The magnets are very strong, so possible for little fingers to get pinched. We keep an eye on the kids so they are careful when playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: star623

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a 2 year old as a gift and he loved it. My 14 month old play along as well, I can only imagine all the things they will both be doing with these as they grow and get the hang of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mafer

customer_reviews.title: Great, not 100 tiles, 100 pieces
customer_reviews.text: Magnetic tiles are the best toy for my two year old. She loves them. It was important to me to get a set big enough that she could build substantially and share with her cousins so I got this 100 piece set. I took off one star bc I while the windows and abc additions are adorable, they are part of the 100 count, leaving me less actual magnetic tiles to build with
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn A.

customer_reviews.title: Engaging and Creative
customer_reviews.text: My three year old who often gets tired of a toy in three minutes, loved to play with these magnet tiles. I was really impressed to see how she was able to use her creative imagination to build buildings, castles, railway tracks, and also create simple star shapes and pyramids of different colors. Whoever came up with this is a genius! I love how durable these are and safe for children of all ages.
customer_reviews.author: RC Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these that I have purchased, because my kids love these so much! They do scratch up, but that's pretty unavoidable with kids. Much better value than other magnetic blocks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Really good and more sturdy than others
customer_reviews.text: Maybe just a smidge more magnet strength than magnatiles but the real sturdiness comes from their flatter surface/sharper corners and edges. That makes them likely a 5-10% more pinch hazard but my 2yr old plays with them fine. Got a great lightning deal so I guess these aren’t price locked like others.
customer_reviews.author: Sokratz

customer_reviews.title: Better value than other magnetic tiles
customer_reviews.text: We bought the original magnetic tiles at first, thinking they were safer. After lots of research, we learned that these have the little bolts that keep them together too and the magnets are just as strong. They are way cheaper though, so you can get more tiles to build more structures. My toddler loves them (and so does her dad).
customer_reviews.author: Corinne LB

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girls during the onset of the Covid-19 quarantine/stay at home order. They really love playing with these, building houses and matching shapes to create all kinds of art. They want to play with them daily and so we've gotten a lot of use out of them already and the colors are really fantastic. Haven't purchased any additional sets yet, but a lot of the concepts would require additional shapes/pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Great magnetic blocks for kids! My son is 2 and he loves them. It comes with a durable carrying and storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sahil Bhalla

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Safe
customer_reviews.text: Researched the top-rated magnetic tile sets because we want toys at our house to entertain grandchildren which improves their ingenuity and dexterity. Playmags was chosen because safety and durability were our prime requirements. The rivets and strong magnets in these pieces met every expectation. Our 2 year old granddaughter played with these for hours upon opening and enjoyed them so much that we ordered another set for our 18 month old grandson in Southern California.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Magna tiles, adds new colors and shapes and little more of the endless fun
customer_reviews.text: This set was bought to complement a couple of Magna Tiles set that my daughter has been playing with since she's 2 - she's 4 now, and the magnetic tiles are the perennial toy in this household, for both kids and parents. The reason for the purchase was mostly to add the window looking tiles, new colors, new shapes with the half squares and the car. unless you look closely, it'd be hard telling which ones are magna tiles vs. the Play Mags apart from colors, works like a charm and my daughter seems really happy with the novelty of the windows for her castles and house builds. I would definitely recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for inventive play
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yo loves these! Great for independent play but also fun for adults to spend time building and playing with kids. The booklet that comes with the set has design ideas which require additional pieces, which is a little annoying. The magnets stick well together but are easy enough to pull apart when it's clean up time. Would gift or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. D.

customer_reviews.title: They are better than OK, but not the best out there.
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT as good as Magna Tiles. I got them for my girls for Easter, and I was disappointed. I suppose when you factor in cost, these are the best you can get for half the price... but I would have gone with genuine Magna tiles. So many glowing reviews putting these just as good or better, they are not awful, but not as good.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had magna tiles to compare but these tiles are great quality. The magnets work well and are not Weak. The structure of what my kids are building would uphold. I’ve always thought of how magna tiles were but I wouldnt buy magna tiles after this purchase since they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Vannie

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't think simple words can describe this amazing toy. it is fun, educative and durable. My son spends hours of play with it. Thank you for making products like this!
customer_reviews.author: Mayj

customer_reviews.title: compatible with Magna set
customer_reviews.text: Item as decribed. Before I buy, my concern is if it is compatible with my Magna sets. The answer is YES, they match perfectly. It also includs a book, teach you many shapes of diffent difficulty level, it is very helpful to give my daughter some ideas. My daughter love them, can play them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend, I bought these before my daughter was 2 now she’s almost 3, they are hands down her absolute favorite toy, (I bought another set of another company and the quality did not compare) great quality, amazing toy that my child has not gotten bored of, she literally plays with them every day!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy our granddaughter loves playing with the Playmags
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy our granddaughter loves playing with the Playmags. Her imagination & creativity shows in when she build structures, mazes and towers plus they have great colors and good shapes to build with too. The magnet is strong and she has spent hours playing so far! We have fun playing with her..Being magnetic the Playmags makes the cleanup easy and quick.
customer_reviews.author: terabackup

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product with a great price. Every child should have these. My son uses them not only for building, but builds structures for his imaginative play. He builds submarines, churches, bouncy houses, aquariums, apartments, "carousel-mixers" and so many other things. I love imaginative toys, and I can honestly say that this is the best one that he has. The magnets are powerful. Buy these! You and your child won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I paid, these are actually great! They held up well, my five-year-old loves them! No complaints at all!
customer_reviews.author: kr611

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!!
customer_reviews.text: With the temperatures cooling off we needed a few indoor activities, these were very well received by my two grandsons. They were so proud of their creations they ask if we could leave them up to display until their next play date! I loved seeing their imaginations going strong!!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Laulie

customer_reviews.title: Stealthy STEM
customer_reviews.text: A very helpful toy. I encourage my sons, 9 and 4, to play hands on. These mag tiles are great! They are simple enough for the youngest, but the oldest can still push the boundaries of engineering. He is now experimenting with struts to make balconies, etc. They also use them to create structures for other toys to utilize, action figures, vehicles etc. I will likely purchase additional sets each Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Trapperdad

customer_reviews.title: My kids love em
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughters and they love them. My younger girl plays with these frequently and doesn't seem to easily get bored with these, which as parents you would know is valuable. The more time they can safely play by themselves, the more time you have to do other stuff besides babysitting! :) Good quality product. Sturdy. I expect them to last. My daughters create structures that I wouldn't have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer King

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I took a star off this product is that the outside packaging came damaged and I was giving this as a gift. Did not have time to exchange so I did my best with shipping tape to make it a little better. Other than than, the quality of the product was just awesome
customer_reviews.author: Jorze

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy!!
customer_reviews.text: We own a small pack of “magna tiles” however they are expensive so I found these, but was a bit leery of the quality due to the price. I am happy to report these are of equal or greater value to magnatiles. The magnets in these are very strong. They are also compatible with magnatiles!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my son for Christmas and he loved them. He plays with them all the time. He actually asked for more so he could build bigger things.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: A must have toy!
customer_reviews.text: Wished I would have purchased them sooner. My 5 & 3 year old play with them everyday and they're holding up great to daily use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clearly the off-brand
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are definitely less sturdy than the magnatiles my kids enjoy playing with at the library. One cracked within an hour of opening the set, and the magnets rattle in the tiles in a way that suggests they are at high risk of breaking and falling out. That said, there are a lot of pieces in the set (though the snap in letters are kind of useless) in a good assortment of shapes, and they're cheaper than magnatiles. I guess it's another case of you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Great new building toy for children!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product!! I bought this for my 4 year old grandson and it was a big hit!! Our son and his family were with us for a month over the holidays. (They live in Europe) The booklet that came with the set gave our grandson and the rest of us many ideas. Even our 17 month old grandson soon figured out how to use them after a while and was able to add on to his brother's creations. It comes with a handy drawstring sack for easy traveling. Needless to say, they went back home with our son and his family!! Would definitely recommend to anybody with young children or grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: One of the best you will buy
customer_reviews.text: This is 3rd time I've purchased this toy I like it so well. It is well constructed and children play with it for years and use their imagination. They haven't gotten tired of it and its nice for them playing alone or along with adult. Adults like it too. So far, of interest to granddaughter at age 4 and 5 so far.
customer_reviews.author: tiger65

customer_reviews.title: We have magformers and I like the idea of these
customer_reviews.text: We have magformers and I like the idea of these, but we were missing pieces and the magnets aren't strong enough to keep the tiles together, anything that is built or attached instantly falls over. We will stick with magformers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever! Strong magnets while easy to take apart.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of the 100 pc set as our kids LOVED their first set so much that they needed more pieces to build more. The magnet of the Playmags are so much stronger than other pricey sets without being difficult to take apart. Would make a great gift for any child as there aren't any little pieces for littles to choke on like Legos (our kids love their Legos as well but definitely not good when littles are around).
customer_reviews.author: B. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great fun, surprisingly strong magnets.
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love these toys! I love how they are so versatile to play with other toys. I think they play with them every day. We ended up buying a second set because one just wasn't enough. They are one toy that I can sit down and play with my kids for a long time. After reading many reviews of different brands I went with playmags and I'm not disappointed. I think all of us have gotten our fingers at least once or twice. I have noticed a couple pieces cracking and we'll keep an eye on them, but my kids play with them very hard!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Pongratz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Set!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5yr old son loves these tiles. We first played with Magna tiles at our children's museum. These Playmags are just as good at a much more reasonable price. They came with a wonderful color idea booklet. We have Playmags and Picasso tiles. Both are equally good and just as good as Magna tiles. All of them are compatible with each other. I have not had any issues with magnets. The magnets are strong and none of them have ever come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: These are AMAZING in Quality
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE BUY THESE and save your money buying the "name brand" Magnatiles. Seriously. These are AMAZING in Quality! They even use this brand at our local Childrens Museum - the museum rarely replaces things (sadly) but in this case I am sure they haven't had to - these probably have gotten played with 8 hours a day 7 days a week for years and they are still in fantastic condition! I got this set for my daughter and she loves them so much. Extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son received these for Christmas, he is 2.5 years old. He loves playing with them and I love that they have a nice storage bag so they aren't all over the floor of his playroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Mom and Toddler Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son and 5 year old daughter play with these every day. They always come up with new ideas for what they are making and they need no instructions on how to make it. These have held up to year’s worth of daily play and toddler throwing. They are indestructible. I love that they are so small when sorted and put away. Such a great creative and clean activity. Get as large of a set as you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Overall great buy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality products. The tile is thick and not too sharp. The included small manual enlighten a lot of idea about how to play with it. Some of the parts like used in the manual are not included in the kits which makes kids keep asking where is it.
customer_reviews.author: Quan Chen

customer_reviews.title: Creative and Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my grandson’s 4th Birthday in July 2018. My grandson loves the magnetic blocks and he builds some pretty amazing designs and is entertained for hours. My 2 1/2 year old grandson loved to play with them so much that I ordered a set for him.
customer_reviews.author: HHISCLADY2011

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these!!! This is such a great set with so many different shapes. My son has legos, wood blocks, foam blocks, big blocks small blocks and everything in between and NOTHING has kept his attention like these magnetic tiles. They are the biggest Christmas win! Definitely get the square base (sold separate) and the car bases (also sold separate). The quality seems great, magnets strong, and the variety is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: Fun magnetic tiles for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love playing with these. Heck I like playing with them too. They are compatible with magna tiles, but I think the magnets in these are even stronger.
customer_reviews.author: El Guapo

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun!
customer_reviews.text: We sent these tiles to our 4 year-old grandson and 2 year-old granddaughter for Christmas! They are having a lot of fun with them...enought tiles to share! A great toy to use creatively over and over!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda T.

customer_reviews.title: Our son loves them
customer_reviews.text: Already ordering more of these - that's the only problem! Your kid wants to build the things shown in the instructions, but you don't have enough tiles to do them. They are well made and the magnets are strong - and considerably less expensive than the big name Magna Tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised with quality
customer_reviews.text: We were lucky to catch a great deal on these so I bought 2 sets. My 3 year old LOVES them! Thank goodness because I am running out of activity ideas. Bought the matching car accessory and they’ve been making trains with them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela V.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the name brand!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered playmags because I didn’t want to fork over the cash for magnatiles...recently got magnatiles as a gift and I think these are so much better!!! Magnets seem stronger in the playmags. Both my 5 yr old and 2 yr old love them and they are entertained for long periods of time. I love seeing their creativity with each new “thing” they build!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Aimee Chimento

customer_reviews.title: Know what tiles shapes are needed
customer_reviews.text: My kids love magnetic tiles similar to these. I was excited about the price for the number of tiles. After receiving it though I was disappointed for the fact that it included about 18 pieces that my kids will not use. Whatever product you buy, consider which shapes are included and which ones you will need to get the most out of your purchase. I did appreciate how they were able to connect with other brands of tiles.
customer_reviews.author: tee

customer_reviews.title: These are great fun, and good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are much less expensive than magnatiles but they work just as well. My three kids (ages 8, 4, & 2) literally play with them most of the day - EVERY DAY.
customer_reviews.author: K. Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Just as good at the expensive brands!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a set of Magna Tiles at the same time so I could compare. They are identical. Even the magnets seem to be exactly as strong as the more expensive brand. We have gotten hours and hours of play with these. I love the size of the set. You really need to have this many to make it fun to play. i Don’t like having a lot of toys around - only the really good ones stay. This is one of the keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Rasire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We love this. My 4 yr old is having so much fun. I noodled on this for a long time due to not wanting to add plastic waste to the world. Finally I pulled the trigger and it is so wonderful for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Castle

customer_reviews.title: What a great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are very similar to magna tiles but so much cheaper. So much so, that I am purchasing for the 2nd time to give my boys more pieces to play with. Our 10 year old and 4 year old actually play best together with playmags. They are creative and have so much fun at it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Same as Magnatiles!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 118 piece set with the clickins for my nephews 5Th birthday, a little disappointed they came in just the product box, but bad on me for not paying for gift wrap I have to say though after playing with my nephews for a few hours these are definitely worth the price and are just like Magnatiles!
customer_reviews.author: SGuzman

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy hands down
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2 and 4 yr olds. They've been playing with it daily for months. This is seriously their absolute favorite toy. They just keep cpming up with new designs and building "homes" for their other toys. Heck, even my mom loves building stuff with the kids. This is an excellent toy for development of hand-eye coordination, imagination, and problem solving skills. I would highly recommend for all ages once old enough to build.
customer_reviews.author: Lera B

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Much more affordable than the major name brand and the magnets are actually stronger. We will probably be getting more of these- all my kids play with them together. Ages range from 3 to 13 and they all will play with these for hours. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 3yo
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 3yo, she has had them about a month and plays with them daily. We plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: This set has enough pieces to build almost anything without having to buy another set.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several similar sets of magnetic tiles for my grandchildren. This is by far the best set you can buy. The tiles indeed have the strongest magnets and the variety an number of tiles included is unbeatable for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ashsmom

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: The grand kids just love these and create all kinds of things, I am ordering more. These don't hurt when you step on them like legos so thats a bonus. I still love legos but I like these even more. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jd chester springs

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these. I decided to go with this one instead of the magnatiles because of price and sturdiness that others claim for have. They are truly very very sturdy for all my kids ranging from 6 yrs to 1 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Yk

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to name-brand Magnatile
customer_reviews.text: These tiles have very strong magnets and line up perfectly with the name-brand Magnatiles (by Valtech). The plastic looks slightly different and scratch a little easier than the namebrand, but since these are mostly used by younger kids, that point is moot. Great product and a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Anson Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids
customer_reviews.text: Ordering was seamless and delivery super fast. This is a Christmas gift so I can’t yet speak to product quality. However, these magnetic blocks are a great gift for kids of all ages and are STEM-friendly. My 2- and 5-year-old granddaughters will sit QUIETLY side-by-side for an hour or two building all kinds of imaginative things. Our only problem has been not having enough of them.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Helms

product_meta.title: Playmags 3D Magnetic Blocks for Kids Set of 100 Blocks to Learn Shapes, Colors, & Alphabet STEM Magnetic Toys Develop Motor Skills&Creativity-Colorful, Durable Magnet Building Tiles & Idea Book
product_meta.description: Fun time : Playmags - 100 Piece Value Set! Playmags 100-piece set includes Eight different shapes so that kids can now stretch their imagination to the next level. More shapes mean more designs, and more designs means more hours of fun play. Educational Fun: Playmags provides great motor skills. Encourages imaginative and creative play, and enhances math, geometry, and science skills. Creativity and critical thinking: high rise 3D towers are designed by kids who have developed into critical thinkers through creative play. As they build, kids develop tools for spatial problem-solving tasks, logical thinking, and math reasoning. Better Learning: Playing with play mag not only give your child an opportunity for greater fun, along with that some basic fundamentals of different dimensions like physics, geometry, math, spatial reasoning and architecture, are being griped by the them. This is the reason that we claim that Playmags gives your child better opportunities for fun along with productive outcomes. Additional features • Made up with superior quality material • Attractive colors • Includes different shapes ; shape reorganization. • 26 x Magnetic Squares (3x3”) - 14 x Magnetic Windows (3x3”) - 4 x Magnetic 4 Sectional Windows (3x3”) - 10 x Magnetic Right-Angled Triangles - 8 x Magnetic Acute Angled Triangles - 12 x Magnetic Equilateral Triangles - 8 x Magnetic Rectangles - 2 x Magnetic Large Squares (6x6”) - 13 x Colorful ABC & Number Clickins - 5 x Colorful Windows Clickins - 1 x Bonus Storage Bag - 1 x Bonus Idea Booklet
feature_bullets: 100 PIECE MAGNETIC TILE PLAY SET: This Playmags Classic Set Lets Kids Build, Play & Learn for Hours of Educational Entertainment; Recommended for Ages 3+
EXTRA POWERFUL TILE MAGNETS: Set Includes 82 Magnetic tiles with Exclusive SUPERMAGS; Strong, Durable Magnets are Great for Building Tall 3D Structures
CLICKINS - LETTERS & WINDOWS FOR LEARNING: 18 Unique Instructive Clickins Pop into Each Tile Window for Added Creativity; Kids & Toddlers Enjoy Many Possibilities
FOR EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT: Engineering Toys Stimulate Problem Solving, Motor Skills & Shape Recognition; Perfect for Preschool Games & Group Activities
PLAY TIME VERSATILITY: Fun, Colorful, Engaging Set Makes a Wonderful Birthday or Christmas Gift for Boys or Girls; Use with Playmags Building Board, Cars & More
